title: Responsive Instructional Design Workshop to Support Fraction Concept Formation in Children with Learning Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics education theory and general understanding of students with learning disabilities
context.additional_context: Experimental workshop designed for pre-service teachers to understand mathematical concept formation in students with learning disabilities and apply responsive teaching methods in actual classrooms

learning_goals: Learners can explain the developmental stages of fraction concepts in students with learning disabilities by categorizing them into three levels.
Based on responsive instructional design principles, design at least two concrete classroom activities for forming the concept of fractions.
Apply teaching strategies for fraction concepts using multiple representation systems (visualÂ·physical manipulatives) to real-world cases.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
